thread.title: U.S. State Department officials did not accompany Pompeo on trip to Pyongyang

title: U.S. State Department officials did not accompany Pompeo on trip to Pyongyang
text:
April 19, 2018 / 8:17 PM / Updated 9 minutes ago U.S. State Department officials did not accompany Pompeo on trip to Pyongyang Reuters Staff 1   U.S. State Department officials did not accompany CIA Director Mike Pompeo to Pyongyang for a meeting with North Korea leader Kim Jong Un over the Easter weekend, a spokeswoman said on Thursday. FILE PHOTO: Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) Director Mike Pompeo testifies during a Senate Intelligence Committee hearing on "Worldwide Threats" on Capitol Hill   February 13, 2018. REUTERS/Leah Millis/File Photo 
Asked whether anyone from the department accompanied Pompeo, who is U.S. President Donald Trump’s nominee for secretary of state, State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert said: “No.” 
At a daily briefing, Nauert said she was not going to be able to get into the details. Reporting by Lesley Wroughton; Editing by Lisa Shumaker
